content.description: A potato falling vertically downward is struck by a dart that is traveling vertically upward, as shown above. The dart and potato then collide, stick together, and continue moving after the collision.
content.question: Consider the dart-potato system. Which of the following graphs best represents the speed v of the center-of-mass of the dart-potato system, as a function of time t, before, during, and after the collision?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis labeled v. At first, v is constant as t increases, then v dips slightly by a small amount and recovers to its previous value. Afterwards, v is constant as t increases further.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis labeled v. At first, v is constant as t increases, then v begins to decrease at a constant rate as t increases for a small period. Afterwards, v remains constant at its lower value as t increases further.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis labeled v. At first, v increases at a constant rate as t increases, then v remains constant as t increases for a small period. Afterwards, v increases again at the same constant rate as it did earlier as t increases further.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis labeled v. Throughout the curve, v increases at a constant rate as t increases.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis labeled v. Throughout the curve, v increases at a constant rate as t increases.
